Pre-Game Insights: Canada will face a very tricky match against France, who can punish even the strongest sides in the world with just one or two chances.
France coach Didier Deschamps will use this match to evaluate his team before they play at Euro 2024.
Canada's men's team have played France just once before, in the group stage of the 1986 World Cup, where Jean-Pierre Papin scored the only goal in a 1-0 loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: France has a star-studded lineup, including Kylian Mbapp√©, who has just moved from Paris Saint-Germain to Real Madrid.
The Canadian players won't be wholly unfamiliar with their foes in blue, as some of them have teammates in Europe's top five leagues.
Others: The match will be played at Matmut Atlantique in Bordeaux, France, on June 9, 2024, at 9:15 p.m. CEST/3:15 p.m. ET.
The match will be broadcast live on OneSoccer & TVA Sports.
